title: Add one-command local first-slice runtime launcher for backend + web shell
description: Create a reproducible launcher that starts the first-slice backend transport host and client-web shell together for local iteration and release-candidate prep without manual multi-terminal setup.
acceptance_criteria: A single documented command starts backend transport host and client shell with deterministic defaults for first-session settlement/world identifiers
Launcher emits clear process URLs/status and exits non-zero when either lane fails to start
Runtime launch docs stay placeholder-art compliant and avoid adding post-slice packaging or production infrastructure scope

title: Run release-blocking gate for transport-backed first-slice candidate
description: Execute the first-slice release gate after transport-host/backend-client runtime integration, publish updated evidence artifacts, and record owner-tagged blockers if any mandatory gate fails.
acceptance_criteria: Release-gate evidence is regenerated for the transport-backed candidate and includes playable, scope, quality, platform, and release-readiness outcomes
Any failing mandatory gate includes exact failing command, artifact path, and explicit owner_role blocker assignment
No additional non-critical QA-only follow-up tasks are created unless a release-blocking failure is observed

title: Align scout unavailable-tile failure key with first-slice manifest canonical key policy
description: Resolve the current transport-only scout unavailable key mismatch by adding an explicit canonical/alias mapping path for unavailable-tile scout failures so endpoint responses, manifest include lists, and frontend key resolution use one deterministic key family.
acceptance_criteria: Scout unavailable-tile failures resolve through a declared canonical key with optional compatibility aliases (no undocumented transport-only key path)
Manifest include/alias tables and event-feed template rows are consistent with the chosen scout unavailable key
Frontend resolver and world-map scout action handling produce the same rendered key for unavailable-tile failures without fallback ambiguity

title: Keep hero dispatch failure branches out of default first-session attack contract rows
description: Ensure default first-session attack UI/error mapping keeps only deterministic hostile dispatch failures in-scope and treats hero failure branches as deferred diagnostics until hero systems are in-slice.
acceptance_criteria: Default first-session hostile dispatch handling prioritizes only `source_target_not_foreign`, `march_already_exists`, `max_active_marches_reached`, and `path_blocked_impassable`
Hero-related dispatch failure keys remain tagged deferred and do not appear in default first-session contract rows
UI fallback behavior for deferred hero failures is explicit and non-blocking when those errors surface in debug/non-default runs

title: Unblock direct Node execution for first-slice HTTP host transport dependency path
description: Normalize the first-slice transport/host runtime chain for direct `node` execution by removing remaining directory imports and unsupported TypeScript syntax usage on the host dependency path so the new HTTP smoke test can run without environment-specific loader constraints.
acceptance_criteria: Running `node --test --test-concurrency=1 --test-isolation=none backend/src/app/transport/first-slice-settlement-loop-http-host.test.ts` succeeds in this repo with no `ERR_UNSUPPORTED_DIR_IMPORT`.
The same command succeeds with no `ERR_UNSUPPORTED_TYPESCRIPT_SYNTAX` errors on loaded first-slice transport dependencies.
Gameplay/contract behavior for first-slice settlement/world-map handlers remains unchanged.

title: Retire scout unavailable hardcoded fallback text after snapshot-backed verification
description: Remove or gate `event.world.scout_unavailable_tile`/`event.scout.unavailable_tile` local fallback strings in `client-web/app.js` once manifest-backed template resolution is confirmed in visual smoke to prevent silent drift between seeded narrative and client literals.
acceptance_criteria: Scout unavailable-tile rendering resolves from manifest-backed templates without requiring local fallback literals
Automated visual smoke run covers a failed scout dispatch and displays the seeded template text
No regression in legacy alias lookup behavior for `event.world.scout_unavailable_tile`
